summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. She is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity between 1994 and 1997, and with perjury for false statements made in a 2016 deposition. The document outlines the allegations of grooming and abuse at multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, facilitating the grooming and abuse of victims as young as 14, and committing perjury in a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as Maxwell's co-conspirator who, with Maxwell's assistance, sexually abused minor girls at his residences in multiple states.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced the charges against Maxwell and made a statement describing Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating Epstein's abuse.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Announced the charges and made a statement praising the bravery of the victims who came forward.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Announced the charges and commended investigators for their work in seeking justice for survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's abuse of minors and, in some cases, participated in the abuse herself.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor bringing charges against Maxwell.
Sweeney, as FBI Assistant Director, announced the charges and investigation leading to Maxwell's arrest.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and an indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: The timeframe during which Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell made several false statements under oath during a civil proceeding, leading to perjury charges.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors as young as 14 years old.
The alleged abuse and grooming occurred from at least 1994 to 1997 at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London residence.
Maxwell's alleged methods included befriending victims, taking them on outings, discussing sexual topics, encouraging them to massage Epstein, and being present during sexual abuse.
Maxwell was also charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in a 2016 civil deposition.
The indictment was the result of an investigation by the FBI and NYPD, and the case was assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
